item.title: Report E-2024090061
item.description:
Report E-2024090061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BIN notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product were released affecting a 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the NOROX® DCP-40CC & -40BKC organic peroxide and all clean-up debris into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080770
item.description:
Report E-2024080770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from ten (10) metal cans due to improperly secured freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 75-gallon poly drum along with the damaged cans, impacted freight and spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight cleaned the impacted area and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081722
item.description:
Report X-2024081722

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08-12-2024 a CN transportation employee smelled a strong chemical odor emanating from tank car #TAEX 1856 while working. in the Kirk Yard in Gary, IN. The CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified and responded to the area to investigate. An assessment of tank car # TAEX 1856 (Residue/UN 1136/Class 3) revealed a vapor release from the pressure relief device which was detected audibly and by the use of a combustible gas detector along with a leak detecting solution. A pressure test was performed via the vapor valve which revealed the tank car to have an internal pressure of 5 psi. The low pressure indicated the pressure relief device was faulty and not performing as intended, allowing vapors to escape. The tank car was moved to an isolation track where the remaining internal pressure was vented through a scrubbing media which stopped the leak. The pressure relief device was then removed and replaced with a blind flange to prevent further leakage. The shipper of record was notified via Chemtrec that the car would require repair and re-qualification by a certified tank car repair facility prior to being released for continued transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024080744
item.description:
Report E-2024080744

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: Hammond
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 110045
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling westbound on I 80 near Hammond, Indiana. Another commercial vehicle failed to maintain their lane of travel and struck the KAG Energy, LLC unit. The KAG Energy, LLC driver lost control and the truck and trailer rolled over. Approximately 45 gallons of crude coal tar was released from the trailer. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
